snippet: Limitations seem to get thrown out when a pitcher is chasing an individual achievement, but a no-hitter can be a manager’s worst nightmare — just ask Terry Collins.
abstract: Never in baseball’s long history has more attention been paid to pitch counts and how they affect a player’s arm health and durability; yet limitations seem to get thrown out when a pitcher is chasing an individual milestone, like a no-hitter or a perfect game; San Francisco Giants pitcher Tim Lincecum threw 148 pitches against San Diego Padres during first no-hitter of his career.

byline.original: By ANDREW KEH and JAY SCHREIBER

lead_paragraph: Limitations seem to get thrown out when a pitcher is chasing an individual achievement, but a no-hitter can be a manager’s worst nightmare — just ask Terry Collins.

headline.main: With a No-Hitter on the Line, Balancing Between Health and History
headline.print_headline: With a No-Hitter on the Line, a Balancing Act Between Health and History
